summary.para: Contains classes and interfaces that allow you to configure your WinForms application in the fluent API-based application builder.
The fluent API-based builder that allows you to configure XPO Middle Tier Security in your WinForms application.
Extends the interface with methods to configure Middle Tier Security authentication in your application.

member.name: M:DevExpress.ExpressApp.Win.ApplicationBuilder.MiddleTierAuthenticationBuilderExtensions.UsePasswordAuthentication(DevExpress.ExpressApp.Win.ApplicationBuilder.IMiddleTierAuthenticationBuilder,System.Action{DevExpress.ExpressApp.Win.ApplicationBuilder.MiddleTierPasswordAuthenticationOptions})

summary.para: Enables standard authentication (with a login and password) in the Middle Tier application server.

member.param: Allows you to enable and configure the Security System in your application, and chain further configuration.
For internal use. Do not specify these settings in your application.

member.name: M:DevExpress.ExpressApp.Win.ApplicationBuilder.MiddleTierAuthenticationBuilderExtensions.UseWindowsAuthentication(DevExpress.ExpressApp.Win.ApplicationBuilder.IMiddleTierAuthenticationBuilder)

summary.para: Enables Windows Authentication in the Middle Tier application server.

member.param: Allows you to enable and configure the Security System in your application, and chain further configuration.

summary.para: Stores handlers for XPO Middle Tier Security events.
Initializes a new instance of the class.

summary.para: Specifies the delegate that configures custom authentication.

member.value: The delegate that configures custom authentication.

summary.para: Extends the interface with methods to configure XPO Middle Tier Security.
Enables and configures XPO Middle Tier Security.

member.param: Allows you to enable and configure the Security System in your application, and chain further configuration.
Options that allow you to configure the Security System.
Options that allow you to configure the Security Module.
member.returns: Allows you to enable and configure the Security System in your application, and chain further configuration.

summary.para: Contains options that you can use to configure XPO Middle Tier Security.
Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:DevExpress.ExpressApp.Win.ApplicationBuilder.MiddleTierSecurityOptions.BaseAddress

summary.para: Specifies the Middle Tier Security server address.

member.value: The Middle Tier Security server address.

summary.para: Provides access to XPO Middle Tier Security events.
Delays the start of the XAF Windows Forms application until the Middle Tier Server is ready to receive and handle client requests.

member.name: M:DevExpress.ExpressApp.Win.ApplicationBuilder.MiddleTierSecurityOptions.WaitForMiddleTierServerReady(System.TimeSpan)

summary.para: Delays the start of the XAF Windows Forms application for a specified period or until the Middle Tier Server is ready to receive and handle client requests.

member.param: A object that specifies the maximum delay duration. When the time runs out, the application starts whether the Middle Tier Server is ready.
